MemberSignature.Value: protected override System.Linq.Expressions.Expression VisitChildren (System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor visitor);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression VisitChildren(class System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor visitor) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function VisitChildren (visitor As ExpressionVisitor) As Expression

abstract member VisitChildren : System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor -> System.Linq.Expressions.Expression override this.VisitChildren : System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor -> System.Linq.Expressions.Expression

Docs.summary: Reduces the node and then calls the method passing the reduced expression. Throws an exception if the node isn't reducible.
Docs.returns: The expression being visited, or an expression which should replace it in the tree.
Docs.remarks: Override this method to provide logic to walk the node's children. A typical implementation will call visitor.Visit on each of its children, and if any of them change, should return a new copy of itself with the modified children.
